tool.name: Filter BlastXML
tool.description: based on e-value and hit position

configfiles.configfile:
<xsl:stylesheet version="1.0" xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform"> <!-- Inspired by https://www.biostars.org/p/15658/ --> <xsl:output method="xml" encoding="UTF-8" indent="yes"/>
<xsl:template match="@*|node()"> <xsl:copy> <xsl:apply-templates select="@*|node()"/> </xsl:copy> </xsl:template>
<xsl:template match="Iteration_hits/Hit"> <xsl:if test='Hit_hsps[Hsp[number(Hsp_evalue) < $evalue and number(Hsp_num) < $topN]]'> <xsl:copy> <xsl:apply-templates select="@*|node()"/> </xsl:copy> </xsl:if> </xsl:template>
<xsl:template match="Iteration_hits/Hit/Hit_hsps/Hsp"> <xsl:if test='self::*[number(Hsp_evalue) < $evalue and number(Hsp_num) < $topN]'> <xsl:copy> <xsl:apply-templates select="@*|node()"/> </xsl:copy> </xsl:if> </xsl:template>
</xsl:stylesheet>

param.label: E-value threshold
param.help: Values below this e-value will be removed
param.name: evalue

param.label: Top N hits
param.name: topN
param.help: Usually blast will return a maxmimum of 500 hits, so set to 500 to disable this check.

tool.help:
**What it does**
Filter BlastXML data by e-value and HSP number which is generally an indicator of best results.
